comment_data.body: I don't think this is correct. It doesn't apply to `:edit` etc..
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -241,9 +241,9 @@ and 'winminwidth' are relevant.
 
 						*:hor* *:horizontal*
 :hor[izontal] {cmd}
-		Execute {cmd}.  Currently only makes a difference for
-		`horizontal wincmd =`, which will equalize windows only
-		horizontally.
+		Execute {cmd} in a horizontal split.  Has no effect on

comment_data.body: I could say "only has an effect for `horizontal wincmd =` and |:terminal|". Felt weird to explicitly list out commands like that, but maybe that is best for now since that is indeed the case.

comment_regular_data.body: This would likely break a lot of plugins. I think the ship has sailed on this -- users who prefer a default split terminal can use a `TermOpen` autocommand or a custom user command to automatically split the terminal window.

Reopening to split out the changes into separate PRs. This PR will allow `:terminal` to take command modifiers. Changing `:terminal` to open a split in a PR is more controversial, so will be in a separate PR.
Added support for `:horizontal` too. Also updated the help text for `:horizontal` a bit (right now it says it only has any effect on `wincmd =`, which would not be true after this change).
